Animation

Single and Double Buffering:

OpenGL provides single and double-buffering. For single buffering a frame is calculated to draw then viewed when completed. For double buffering one frame is displayed while the other is drawn. When the drawing of a frame is complete, the two buffers are swapped, so the one that was being viewed is now used for drawing, and vice versa.

We initialize single buffering by calling glutInitDisplayMode(GLUT_SINGLE….) routine, and double buffering by a call to glutInitDisplayMode(GLUT_DOUBLE......) in the main function. We swap buffers to create an animation by calling glutSwapBuffers() routine in our display() function. To see how the animation would be different when using single buffering and double buffering, check out the examples.
